definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to deceive/there is none/old variant of 網|网[wang3]

sentences.english: But these warnings were ignored, and the crisis came.
sentences.chinese: 這些警告被置若罔聞，結果危機來了。

sentences.english: She also ignored his call as she pushed through the double glass doors.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆穿過雙扇玻璃門，對身後的呼喚也置若罔聞。

sentences.english: Is the cello listening to the answer, or is it oblivious?
sentences.chinese: 大提琴是否接受了這個回答，還是對其置若罔聞？

sentences.english: The government even turned a deaf ear to the direct intervention by the ILO.
sentences.chinese: 同時，國民政府對國際勞工局的直接干預也置若罔聞。

sentences.english: " said Mrs. Jennings, without attending to her daughter's reproof .
sentences.chinese: 詹寧斯太太說，對女兒的責備置若罔聞。

sentences.english: You cannot ignore them once truly heard.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你真的聽到，就不能置若罔聞。

sentences.english: He turns a deaf ear to what the boss says, never taking it seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他對老闆的話置若罔聞，根原不把它當回事。

sentences.english: This isn't easy for most people to accept, which is why they might dismiss an article like this.
sentences.chinese: 當然多數人對此置若罔聞，因爲這的確易說難行。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
